abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments over whether Virginia officials engaged in unconstitutional racial gerrymandering when redrawing legislative zones; case's central question is how to distinguish overlapping influences of race and partisanship, given black voters' traditional preference for Democrats.
lead_paragraph: The case of Wittman v. Personhuballah asks if Virginia lawmakers had run afoul of the Constitution by putting too many black voters in an oddly shaped district.

headline.main: Roles of Race and Partisanship in Legislative Maps Argued at Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Justices Hear Arguments on Devising District Maps

snippet: The case of Wittman v. Personhuballah asks if Virginia lawmakers had run afoul of the Constitution by putting too many black voters in an oddly shaped district.
